fields.description:
Hi everyone

Â 

*First case*

I failed to import the attached xar file called export19(13) (which has been exported from a 12.9 release) to my 12.10.8 release. I could successfully export and import the attached file within the 12.9 release. So, I assume that the file is okay.

Â 

*Second reproduction of the bug*

I have found another way to reproduce the bug. If I export the article "one Article.xar" in the release 12.9 and import it to 12.10.8 everything works fine. If I do the same thing with the articles (4 articles.xar) it also works fine. But If i do this with "too many articles.xar" it fails when importing the file into of 12.10.8.

What is the difference between all these files? Basically, one article.xar contains just one article and the other ones contains just multiple copies of it (see image below).

!image-2021-08-16-15-00-56-899.png|width=1084,height=651!

Â 

Therefore, I can say that importing one article works, importing many articles fails, even if all those articles are just a copy of the one which worked.

Â 

Regards

AndrÃ©
fields.summary: Export XAR from XWiki Debian 12.9 to XWiki Debian 12.10.8 fails

The short text fields in the live tables used with App Within Minutes are not searchable by default.Â Â

fields.description:
The user picker (or page picker or any other similar picker) won't display properly when trying to add a macro that uses it inside a page. You start typing the user and no suggestions are prompted.

To reenact this bug, one has to create a page, save it and then edit it in form mode.Â 

Adding the macro during the page creation works, adding the macro while editing the page in wysiwyg mode works, adding the macro within the wysiwyg of a single property works.

components.name: Live Data
components.description: A UI component useful to display dynamic lists of data.

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Wiki Index page
 # Mouse hover over an entry in the 'Membership Type' column from the Live data Table

EXPECTED RESULTS

The 'Edit' floating button is not displayed, since the 'Membership Type' column is not user editable.

ACTUAL RESULTS

The 'Edit' button is displayed and when clicked the respective row's entry becomes apparently editable, but the changes are not saved.

More generally, the issue occurs when a LD has the liveTable source, both a className and a resultPage in its source parameters and an property returned by the source, but that does not correspond to a property in the configured XClass.
fields.summary: 'Edit' floating button should not be displayed for not editable columns in Live Data table
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64bit, Chrome 92, using an instance of XWiki 13.6 on MariaDB 10.6, Tomcat 9.0.50

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Create an user (e.g. U1)
 # Create a subwiki
 # Go to Wiki Index page
 # Mouse hover over the current subwiki owner
 # Click 'Edit' floating button
 # Change the owner to U1

EXPECTED RESULTS

A warning is displayed informing thatÂ once this is changed, the previous owner will lose their owner rights, like the warning from Administer Wiki > Wikis > Descriptor.

ACTUAL RESULTS

No warning is displayed. This may cause issues like users locking themselves out of their wiki.
fields.summary: Changing a Wiki Owner from WikiManager Live Data table should display the corresponding warning from Administration

fields.description:
I've just installed XWiki from Debian packages on bullseye but found that Tomcat didn't start because of the pulled-in Java 17 JRE (openjdk-17-jre-headless). In order to fix this, I had to manually install the default-jre package to get openjdk-11-jre.

Please fix package dependencies to default-jre instead of "java8-runtime".

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* Add the following in a wiki page {noformat}[[image:image.png||width="20%"]]{noformat}
* Upload an attachment named image.png on that page
* Verify that the image is displayed with the 20% resize
* Click edit to go either in inplace editing or standalone editing
* Notice that the image is no longer displayed using 20% and click source and notice that the width parameter has disappeared.
* Save
fields.summary: "width" parameter is lost when editing in WYSIWYG

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 * Log in as Admin
 * Clear all notifications if any
 * In the notifications menu, set "Watch this wiki" ton "on"
 * In User Profile > Notifications > Applications, set Notifications menu for Pages to "on"
 * In User Profile > Notifications > System Filters, set Minor Event (Alert) filter to "off"
 * In a distinct session, log in as a distinct user and bring a minor modification to page "Sandbox.WebHome"
 * In the Admin session, reload current page

h2. Expected result
 * A notification shows up about the minor change brought by another user to page "Sandbox.WebHome"

h2. Actual result
 * The notification menu is empty.

Note that if a major change is brought, the notification shows up as expected.
fields.summary: No notification is displayed for minor changes despite the minor event alert filter being off

fields.description:
You can reproduce on two ways:

* on pages displayed with sheets, because they are not editable in-place (with the WYSIWYG editor), e.g. {{Help.Applications.Contributors.Charlie Chaplin}}
* on plain wiki pages, if you [disable in-place editing|https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Configuration/#HIn-placeEditing], e.g. {{Sandbox.WebHome}}

The issue is that the annotation popup doesn't load the WYSIWYG editor sources, so it works only if the WYSIWYG editor sources are already loaded. This can happen if:

* in-place editing is enabled for the current page
* the comments tab loads the WYSIWYG editor, but this doesn't happen anymore since XWIKI-17656.

Short history:

* 12.3 we add support for in-place editing
* 12.6 we add support for WYSIWYG editor in comments and annotations
** the bug can still be reproduced if the Comments tab is not the default tab (e.g. open the Attachments tab and reload the page)
* 12.7 / 12.6.2 we stopped loading the WYSIWYG editor when the Comments tab is loaded (you need to click on a button, XWIKI-17656); this made the bug more visible

I checked the response for the request to {{AnnotationCode.CreateForm}} and there's no script tags in the returned HTML and there's no {{X-XWIKI-HTML-HEAD}} header so we need to fix two things:

* include the required script (declaration) in the response, either in the body or using the HTTP custom header (preferred way)
* load the required JavaScript specified on the response from the annotation JavaScript code
fields.summary: The WYSIWYG editor doesn't always load when adding an annotation

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:
  - Create a new page named Foo
  - Create another page named Bar with the following content:
{noformat}
{{warning}}
Check this out: [[Foo>>Foo.WebHome]]
{{/warning}}
{noformat}
  - Go to page Foo and open "information" tab

Expected result:
  - a backlink has been created to the page Bar and is listed in the information tab

Obtained result:
  - no backlink is created

Note that an important side effect of this bug is that the refactoring operations are not applied on page Bar, whenever Foo is renamed for example: the link will be broken in that case.
fields.summary: Links located in macros are not saved as backlinks

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :
* Start with a clean instance
* Import the attached XAR package, it contains a simple AWM with 1 content page
* Edit the content page in object mode, try to add a new object of the "my test app" class

Expected : the object gets added
Actual : when refreshing the page, the object is not displayed anymore

This seems to come from the improvements performed as part of XWIKI-16210 : when a document is saved, we check if a request parameter {{addedObjects}} exists, and try to register the objects to add to the document.

In order to validate the contents of the request parameter {{addedObjects}}, we apply a regex {{XOBJECTS_REFERENCE_PATTERN}}, defined [here|https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/e59b3e39311d044c1b52aff5ebda8fcc3269f8da/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/EditForm.java#L59] ; the issue is that this pattern does not cover classes which have special characters (spaces, \, /, â¦) in their document name.

While it's a good practice to create class documents without special characters in their document names, it's certainly not the case always :) :Â for example, it's always possible to create an AWM with special characters.

This may also impact the pattern {{XPROPERTY_REFERENCE_PATTERN}} [here|https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/e59b3e39311d044c1b52aff5ebda8fcc3269f8da/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/EditForm.java#L52].
fields.summary: It's not possible to add new XObjects of classes containing spaces in object mode

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :â¯
* Start with a fresh instance
* In the administration, remove the naming strategy that removes "/" from page name
* Create a page with a slash in its name
* Try to edit the page 

Expected :â¯the WYSIWYG inline editor pops up

Actual :
* The user gets a message saying that XWiki is unable to load the page
* The result of the ajax call to /xwiki/rest/..../spaces/xxxxxx/?timestamp=xxxxxxx that is made to get the content of the document returns "Malformed URL: the spaces section is invalid."

Note : Even though we do have a naming strategy to prevent new pages from having this special character in their name, there are multiple situations in which a standard user could get the issue :â¯
* Either itâs a long-lived page that has been there in previous versions of the wiki, and suddenly the page stops being easily editable because the wiki has been upgraded
* Or itâs a page that has been imported from a 3rd party platform, which does not enforce any rules for page names
fields.summary: A page with a slash ("/", %2F) in its name cannot be inline-edited

fields.description:
Before https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/b61436747ed7ab311e5ff65d3f79e34e008ef93f, some functional tests (including `xwiki-platform-mail-test-docker`) were failing with a *Java heap space* error.
Now that the fix is applied, {{MailIT#verifyMail}} is failing on {{docker-all}}` and {{docker-latest}}, because the {{TestDatabaseMailListener}} is not loaded in the XWiki instance, and {{DatabaseMailListener}} is used instead in the test, leading to an unexpected value being found in the mail status table by selenium.
fields.summary: MailIT.verifyMail is failing

fields.description:
Since the changes performed to get rid of struts in 13.0 we apparently lost the capability to execute an EntityResourceReferenceHandler. 
It uses to be possible through a fallback on XWikiAction with an UnknownAction and then a call to the EntityResourceReferenceHandler. Now there's a check if the action exist, which prevents this call to the EntityResourceReferenceHandler.
fields.summary: EntityResourceReferenceHandler are not called anymore

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE

# Create the following page structure: P1/P2/P3/
# Add some (distinctive) content on each page
# Export P1 with children pages to PDF using:
{code}<server>/bin/export/P1/WebHome?format=pdf&pdfcover=1&pdfcover=0&pdftoc=1&pdftoc=0&pdfheader=1&pdfheader=0&pdffooter=1&pdffooter=0&includechilds=2{code}

EXPECTED RESULTS

The PDF is exported successfully and includes the content of P1 and its children: P2 and P3.

ACTUAL RESULTS

Only the content of P1 page is displayed in the exported PDF.

The issue could not be reproduced on XWiki 13.3 or XWiki 12.10.7.
fields.summary: Pages with children cannot be exported to PDF anymore using "&includechilds="
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 91, using a local instance of XWiki 13.4 (PostgreSQL 13/ Tomcat)

components.name: Live Data
components.description: A UI component useful to display dynamic lists of data.

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE

I've chosen the following steps since they apply both to Live Data and Live Table:
 # Login as Admin
 # Create some subwikis
 # Grant Wiki Creation right to an user (e.g. U1) and create also one or more subwikis with the user
 # Go to Drawer > Wiki Index
 # In Owner column, click once and select an username (Admin or U1)
 # Delete the filtered username and click again the filter drop-down box

EXPECTED RESULTS

All usernames are displayed in the filter drop-down (including the previously filtered username that was just cleared from the box).

ACTUAL RESULTS

TheÂ previously filtered username (that was just cleared) is not displayed in the list. If the table is filtered by another user, and then the filter is cleared again, this user is also missing from the list.

On a Live Data Table the page needs a refresh to display back all the users/groups in the filter list, while on a Live table the user has to navigate again to the page containing the table.

The same happens on an AWM home page table containing an user or a group live columns.
fields.summary: Username or group is missing from the filter drop-down after being filtered by in a table
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 91, using a local instance of XWiki 13.4 (PostgreSQL 13/ Tomcat)

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Create some users
 # Create some groups
 # Create an AWM with "User" and "Group" fields
 # Add the "User" and "Group" fields as Live table columns in "Step 4 -Â Customize your application home page"
 # Add some entries in the AWM application
 # In AWM home page Live table, filter by an user or by a group
 # Delete the filtered username or group in order to display back all entries in the table

EXPECTED RESULTS

All entries are displayed back in the table.

ACTUAL RESULTS

Nothing happens, the rest of the entries are not displayed back.Â 

Since there is no "All" option in the User or Group filters drop-down, in order to display again all entries in the table it's needed to manually navigate again toÂ the AWM home page.

I've attached an example from the WikiManager table on XWiki 12.10.7.
fields.summary: Entries are not displayed back when removing the user or group filters in a Live table
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 91, using a local instance of XWiki 12.10.7 (Jetty/HSQL)

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Create some subwikis
 # (Optional) Grant Wiki Creation right to an user and create also one or more subwikis with the user
 # Go to Drawer > Wiki Index
 # In Owner column, filter by an username (Admin or user that created the subwikis)

EXPECTED RESULTS

The entries are filtered properly. If Admin is selected from drop-down list, then all subwikis created by him are displayed and the same for the user.

ACTUAL RESULTS

No entries are displayed.

Since there is no "All" option in the Owner filter drop-down, in order to display again all entries in the Live Data table it's needed to navigate again toÂ WikiManager page (a simple page refresh it's not enough).
fields.summary: Subwikis cannot be filtered by Owner in WikiManager Live Data table
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 91, using a local instance of XWiki 13.4 (PostgreSQL 13/ Tomcat)

fields.description:
Some live data sources needs to display messages at the bottom of the Live Data under some conditions.

For instance, when displaying a Live Data with using the {{liveTable}} source and displaying the {{doc.title}} property with {{sortable=true}} or {{filterable=true}}, the message "(1) Some pages have a computed title. Filtering and sorting by title will not work as expected for these pages." must be displayed at the bottom of the table.
In addition, the cells triggering this error must be listed along the message and suffixed with the corresponding number.

Another known case is displaying warning if some listed pages are not viewable by the current user.

 !Screenshot 2021-06-09 at 17-01-34 Sandbox - XWiki.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Live Data source should be able to display contextual error/warning messages

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Login with Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Social > Notifications
 # Change some toggles settings for System Filters (e.g. System filter to OFF)
 # Create a Custom filter for the Sandbox page
 # Create a new user (e.g. U1)
 # Login with U1
 # Click on the Notifications bell
 # Click on Settings, in the right side of Notifications

Expected results:Â For a new user, all settings configured by Admin in Administration are reflected in the user's Notifications Preferences.

Actual results: Settings are shown as selected, but theÂ Custom Filters are doubled.
fields.summary: Custom Filters doubles with events enabled by default

components.name: Edit
components.description: APIs to associate editors to data types; in-place editing

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
# create a document
# add 2 annotations on that document, from view mode
# refresh the page (so that annotations view dissapears and the page displays clean as when you enter the page)
 !image-2021-06-02-14-04-46-154.png|thumbnail! 
# click "Edit" (Modifier in my french screenshot) to enter in-place edit mode:
 !image-2021-06-02-14-08-12-297.png|thumbnail! 
# at this point, go in the kebab menu, click annotations and then in the subsequently displayed panel, check "show annotations"
# the annotations will be displayed in the content that is edited in-place
!image-2021-06-02-14-09-44-253.png|thumbnail! 
# click save and close (Enregistrer & fermer in my french screenshots)

Actual results:
* yellow areas are now displayed in view mode of the page, even when annotations are not displayed:
!image-2021-06-02-14-11-32-400.png|thumbnail! 

* the html used for displaying annotations in view mode is now saved in the page content:
 !image-2021-06-02-14-13-32-451.png|thumbnail! 

Expected results:
Globally, the objective is to never save annotations markup in the page content.
In detail, as for the other edit modes, I would expect this to be achieved by not being able to use annotations at all when editing in place.

Variation 1: at step 5 in the list of steps above, instead of displaying annotations from the menu, select a piece of text and then hit the Ctrl + M shortcut: the UI to add an annotation will be displayed. Add an annotation with this UI. After the annotation add, all other annotations available on the document will be displayed. This happens and annotations markup is also saved when this happens.

Variation 2: I haven't yet checked what happens when the annotations are configured to be always loaded on the pages, this _may_ also happen.
fields.summary: Annotations can be displayed when editing a page in place and annotation markup is saved in the page content in that case

 * On the filters sections, click on the "+ Add Filter" button to create a new filter
 * On the creation form fill the fields with the values you want except for the field "EVENT TYPE" keep it empty
 * Click on the "Save" button and notice the results

See screenshot :

!create-filter.png|thumbnail!

*Expected result :*Â A new filter has been added to the user notification filters

*Actual result :* Nothing happen, no filter added

This error is displayed on the browser console after the click on the save button, see screenshot :Â 

!notification-creation-error.png|width=425,height=239! Â  Â
fields.summary: Cannot create notification filters for all event types

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Create a subwiki with User scope:Â 'Both global and local users are available in the wiki' and with Membership type 'Open for any user to join'
 # Create an user (e.g. U1)
 # Login as U1
 # Go to Wiki Index
 # Observe the available options in the Actions column on Live Data table

EXPECTED RESULTS

For the subwiki created previously, the available option for the user is '+Join'.

ACTUAL RESULTS

The 'Actions' column is empty, no options are displayed.

The issue could not be reproduced on XWiki 13.3.
fields.summary: The WikiManager LiveData 'Actions' column is empty for a simple user
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 91, using a local instance of XWiki 13.4 on PostgreSQL 13/ Tomcat 8.5.66

fields.description:
When double clicking on a cell displaying an XObject property of type date, the cell is switched to a text field.

This text field is supposed to be enhanced with a date picker (see XObject inline editing).

This is not the case in LD and the following error is displayed in the browser's console:

fields.description:
When loading the Wiki manager for the first time after a subwiki is created, there's nothing that shows that a live data is being loading, so only the create button is displaying which is a bit disturbing especially since the LD takes a few time to load. 
In my case I thought for a moment that I was on a wrong instance because I couldn't see any placeholder so I thought there was no subwikis at all. 

We should always have a placeholder immediately visible when a LD is available, even if it's not loaded at all.
fields.summary: Missing placeholder for the first load of a LD table

components.name: Live Data
components.description: A UI component useful to display dynamic lists of data.

fields.description: The problem is that the {{xobjectPropertyDisplayer}} requests the display value for each object property even though it has it already in the live data entries. It only needs to request the edit mode. The view mode would have to be requested only if we were updating individual cells after editing, but since we're updating the entire live data page it means we should never request the view mode. We only need to request the edit mode. The view mode is available in the live data JSON.
fields.summary: Too many HTTP requests made when loading a Live Data that displays xobjects

fields.description:
Follow these steps to reproduce:

* Go to the Panels home page
* Double click to edit the type of a panel from the Live Data and select "--"
* Try to double click again to restore the previous value; it doesn't work in Firefox; it works in Chrome

The issue seems to be that Firefox doesn't apply the {{height:100%}} on the empty display DIV. We may have to use {{min-height}} instead.
fields.summary: Cannot edit empty cells in Firefox

fields.description:
Double clicking on the text in a cell of type link makes the browser follow the link instead of switching the cell in edit mode.
We should find a way to prevent the link to be followed when the cell is editable.

Proposition:
1. Waits a few ms to see if the simple click is a double click before following the link
2. Show a small tooltip with "follow link/edit" when clicking the link

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Unzip a fresh instance of XWiki 12.10.7 (Jetty+HSQLDB) with Standard Flavor Pre-installed
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Extensions > Updater
 # Click 'Check for updates'

EXPECTED RESULTS

No update should be proposed for Admin User Application as the version 12.10.7 is already installed.

ACTUAL RESULTS

An update to Admin User Application 13.3 (or 13.x) is proposed.

This happens only on a 12.10.7 instance with Standard Flavor Pre-installed. If the "data" folder is deleted and the DW is run to re-install the (Standard) flavor, no update is proposed.
fields.summary: Extension updater proposes to upgrade Admin User Application to 13.3 on a 12.10.7 instance with Standard Flavor Pre-installed
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Firefox 88, using a local instance of XWiki 12.10.7 on HSQL 2.5.1, Jetty 9.4.29

fields.description:
Step to reproduce.
# Go to the main page, look at the source. The part we are interested in is:
{code}
<link href="      /xwiki/bin/skin/skins/flamingo/style.min.css?cache-version=1617814542000&skin=XWiki.DefaultSkin&colorTheme=xwiki%3AFlamingoThemes.Iceberg
  " rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" media="all" />
{code}
# Go the the "Iceberg" theme, make random change, and save the page
# Go back to the main page, look at the source. The part we are interested in is:
{code}
<link href="      /xwiki/bin/skin/skins/flamingo/style.min.css?cache-version=1617814542000&skin=XWiki.DefaultSkin&colorTheme=xwiki%3AFlamingoThemes.Iceberg
  " rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" media="all" />
{code}

As you can see, the "cache-version" parameter (that is used to force the browser not to use a cached version of the file when a change is made) has not changed, because it only considers the "style.min.css" file, not the flamingo theme.

As a consequence, the user cannot see the change unless she clears her browser's cache.

To avoid this, we need to add the version of the theme into the query string, so when the theme is changed, the url is different.
fields.summary: The skin style is not refreshed when the color theme is modified

fields.description:
Our environment: Windows 10, Java 1.8.202 64bit, Tomcat 9.0.45 as Servlet Container, XWiki 12.10.6 LTS WAR installed, MySQL 5.7 DB

After Migration from 11.10.4 LTS to 12.10.6 LTS we notice that the object editor does not save objects from a class that has a name containing a minus sign (like "Sequence-Followed Class"). Refreshing the page and checking database and logs shows, that only the page content was saved, but not the object, despite the fact, that XWiki UI shows only success messages ('object added', 'saved').

*Steps to reproduce:* create new class with minus sign in class name, add some dummy property like string and save the class. Create new blank page, edit with object editor, choose the new class from drop down, save the page. Reload the page: your new class is gone.

If we use velocity code to add the object or use a template, where the object had already been attached before migration, everything works fine! Renaming the maligne class name does not help, presumably the old name with minus sign is kept internally and prevents the save action of the object editor.

If we add an object of a class without minus sign in the name, no matter whether XWiki core or self-designed class, it works.

The bug must be hidden in the save action of the object editor.
fields.summary: Object Editor does not save objects with class names containing minus sign

fields.description:
Upgrading from 11.10.4 to 12.10.6 with xinit set up to manage tomcat's lifecycle:

{noformat}
...
Setting up xwiki-tomcat9-mysql (12.10.6) ...
dpkg: error processing package xwiki-tomcat9-mysql (--configure):
 installed xwiki-tomcat9-mysql package post-installation script subprocess returned error exit status 3
Errors were encountered while processing:
 xwiki-tomcat9-mysql
E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (1)
W: Operation was interrupted before it could finish
{noformat}

Investigating, I get to:

{noformat}
root@host:/home/user# less /var/lib/dpkg/info/xwiki-tomcat9-mysql.postinst 
root@host:/home/user# systemctl -q is-active tomcat9.service
root@host:/home/user# echo $?
3
root@host:/home/user# systemctl status tomcat9
â tomcat9.service - Apache Tomcat 9 Web Application Server
   Loaded: loaded (/lib/systemd/system/tomcat9.service; disabled; vendor preset: enabled)
  Drop-In: /etc/systemd/system/tomcat9.service.d
           ââxwiki-tomcat9-systemd.conf
   Active: inactive (dead)
     Docs: https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-9.0-doc/index.html
{noformat}

Possibly the solution is to replace the oneliner with an if that never ends up in an exit code other than 0.

Looks related or caused by XWIKI-17883.

*Workaround*:

{noformat}
# systemctl start tomcat9
# dpkg --configure xwiki-tomcat9-mysql
{noformat}
fields.summary: xwiki-tomcat9-mysql postinstall fails at upgrade on Debian when the tomcat9 service is stopped and disabled

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Go to a page
 # On that page, click on Attachments Tab
 # Click 'Edit' button to edit the page
 # Click 'Cancel'

EXPECTED RESULTS

The page is directed to View Mode, no other buttons are displayed in Attachments Tab section.

ACTUAL RESULTS

The page is directed to View Mode, but on Attachment Tab, below the "Browse" button are displayed another 2 buttons: "Attach" and "Cancel".

If clicked on "Cancel", the page is refreshed and these 2 buttons disappear, but when clicked on "Attach", a warning is displayed for the request containing an invalid authentication information.

At this point if clicked "Yes" the user is directed to a page titled 'Uploading files to $escapetool.xml($redirect)' (with a notice about no files being found on the request) and if clicked "No", the user is directed to "$escapetool.xml($redirect)" (non existent page).

It is to be mentioned that "Attach" and "Cancel" buttons disappear if the page is refreshed (F5).

The issue doesn't reproduce on XWiki 12.10.5 and XWiki 13.1.
fields.summary: "Attach" and "Cancel" buttons are displayed in Attachment Tab when canceling in-place edit mode
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Firefox 88, using a local instance XWiki 13.3 on Oracle 19c, Tomcat 9.0.45

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Social > Notifications
 # Under System Filters section, change a toggle preference for a filter (e.g. set 'Own Events Filter' to OFF)
 # Refresh the page (F5)

EXPECTED RESULTS

The toggle preference for the filter remains set to OFF.

ACTUAL RESULTS

Although the "Filter preference saved!" success message is displayed, the toggle changes back to ON after page refresh.Â 

If a new user is created at this point, It inherits the OFF setting for this respective filter.

However, it seems the setting cannot be turned back to ON to be inherited as a Global System Filter by a new user.

I've logged back in with Admin, gone to Administration and changed the filter toggle to OFF, then to ON, then created another user; after that, I've changed the filter toggle to ON > OFF> ON again and created another user.

It seems that all new users inherit only the OFF state of this filter toggle.
fields.summary: Changes of Global System Filters toggles state are not kept after page refresh and the inherited state of modified filters is always OFF

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to Notifications Settings, click "+Add filter" button and create some Custom Filters
 # Edit a page with CKEditor
 # AddÂ Notifications Custom Filters Preferences Macro
 # Observe the existing filters on the macro
 # Click on the top right bell icon > Notifications > Settings
 # On the Custom Filters section, add a new filter and change some existing filters' settingsÂ (turn some toggles ON/OFF)
 # Go to the edited page and observe the filters on the macro
 # On the Macro, delete a filter and change some existing filters' settings
h5. Â 
h5. Expected results

The Notifications Custom Filters Preferences Macro is displayed into the page. The filters are synchronized with the existing ones on Notification Settings. If they are changed from the Macro, the updates are reflected on Notification Settings and vice versa.

*ACTUAL RESULTS*

The Notifications Custom Filters Preferences Macro is displayed into the page.

If the changes are made from Notification Settings, the updates are reflected on Macro but vice versa does not work. Trying to delete a filter or change a filter settings (ON/OFF) from Macro gives the error shown in screenshot attached.Â 

The issue does not reproduce on XWiki 13.2 and reproduces only on Jetty.

Â 

Â
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior of Notifications Custom Filters Preferences Macro

STEPS TO REPRODUCE
# Login as Admin (without Display Hidden Pages to No)
# Go toÂ http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/AppWithinMinutes/
# Observe the livetable
# Go to profile and set Display Hidden Pages to Yes
# Go to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/AppWithinMinutes/ > Movies and Contributors

EXPECTED RESULTS

The Movies and Contributors apps are not hidden and displayed in http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/AppWithinMinutes/ Livetable. Each application has 2 demo entries:
For Movies: Meet John Doe and Modern Times
For Contributors: Frank Capra and Charlie Chaplin

ACTUAL RESULTS

The applications are hidden (not listed on LT unless the user has Display Hidden Pages set to Yes) and their demo entries are missing.

The issue does not reproduce on XWiki 13.2.

h5. Steps to reproduce
 # Edit a page with CKEditor
 # Click Insert > Other Macros
 # Search for Notifications Applications Preferences Macro
 # Select it
 # Click 'Submit'
 # Click 'Save & View'
 # Observe the existing settings on the macro (on 'Notification menu' and 'Email')
 # Click on the top right bell icon > Notifications > Settings
 # On the Application section, change the toggle for 'Notification menu' and 'Email' to the opposite setting
 # Go to the edited page and observe the settings on the macro
 # On the Macro, change the toggle for 'Notification menu' and 'Email' to the opposite setting
 # Observe the settings on the Notification Settings

h5. Expected results
The Notifications Applications Preferences Macro is displayed into the page. Both settings ('Notification menu' and 'Email') are synchronized with the existing ones on Notification Settings.

*ACTUAL RESULTS*

TheÂ Notifications Applications Preferences Macro is displayed into the page.

If they are changes from the Notification Settings, the updates are reflected on Page with Macro but vice versa does not work.Â The settingsÂ ('Notification menu' and 'Email') are notÂ synchronized when the changes are made from Macro even if the change is saved.Â

fields.description:
This happens for instance if you do this in a test:
 * call TestUtils#deletePage(), which deletes the page and leaves you on the missing page in view mode
 * call TestUtils#createPage() just after, the save URL redirects back to view mode so on the same page as before, the current URL doesn't change and this makes {{gotoPage}} timeout because it expects the current URL to change

To reproduce:

The "Help.SupportPanel.WebHome" (which is still displayed) has been lost.

There is no error/warning in the browser console.

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Social > Notifications
 # Add a custom filter, e.g.
 Location -> "Sandbox.TestPage1"
 Action -> Notify of the event
 Events type (Pages) -> A page is modified
 Channel -> Alert & Email
 # Create a user
 # Close and restart XWiki instance
 # Go toÂ Administer Wiki > Social > Notifications

EXPECTED RESULTS

The global custom notification filter is still displayed in Administer Wiki > Social > Notifications.

ACTUAL RESULTS

The global custom filter is missing. As a result, new created users will not inherit the filter setting.

It is to be mentioned that this does not happen every time the server is restarted. Unfortunately, I couldn't discover a pattern to follow in order to reproduce the issue every time.

Reproduced on both Jetty 9.4.29 and Tomcat 9.0.45.

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Access a Jetty+HSQL instance with Chrome or Edge browser
 # Login as an user
 # Go to Notifications Settings and add a custom filter for a page, e.g.:
 Location -> "Sandbox.TestPage1"
 Action -> Notify of the event
 Events type (Pages) -> A page is modified
 Channel -> Alert & Email
 # Click on Notifications Bell and switch 'Watch this wiki' toggle to OFF
 # Refresh the page

EXPECTED RESULTS

In addition to the existing global filter for Sandbox.TestPage1, another custom filter is added for the whole Wiki with ignoring all the events.

ACTUAL RESULTS

The ignore all events filter is added, but on its location is displayed also 'Sandbox.TestPage1' instead of Wiki.

The filter does not display the correct location even if the page is hard refreshed or browser cache is cleared most of the times.

IfÂ  'Watch this wiki' toggle is switched to ON, then again to OFF, the location is correct, but after one or two page refreshes, it displays back 'Sandbox.TestPage1'.

Other times afterÂ toggle is switched to OFF, then again to ON, the *initial custom filter* disappears and is not displayed back at all.

The issue seems to not reproduce on Tomcat, but only on Jetty with Chrome and Edge browsers, on Firefox and IE11 the location is correctly displayed from the start.

The issue could not be reproduced on XWiki 13.2 or 12.10.6.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior of custom notifications filters
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 90, using a local instance XWiki 13.3 RC1 on HSQLDB 2.5.1, Jetty 9.4.29

fields.description: I'm not sure if the following vulnerability (from 2012) has been caught as I found and tested it on two recent versions of XWiki. Sorry if I create a duplicate. Â  Several stored XSS vulnerabilities are present on XWiki. To create them, you just need to create a user account, without any particular rights, which is possible for an anonymous person on the Internet.Several stored XSS vulnerabilities are present on XWiki. To create them, you just need to create a user account, without any particular rights, which is possible for an anonymous person on the Internet. The vulnerable settings are located on the user's profile page. When editing the user's profile, the following parameters, sent in a POST request, are vulnerable. The tests were performed with the user **TestDigitalSecurity**. * request : POST /bin/preview/XWiki/TestDigitalSecurity * vulnerable parameters identifed (version 11.10.3): ** XWiki.XWikiUsers_0_first_name ** XWiki.XWikiUsers_0_last_name ** XWiki.XWikiUsers_0_company ** XWiki.XWikiUsers_0_phone ** XWiki.XWikiUsers_0_blog ** XWiki.XWikiUsers_0_blogfeed Â Other parameters could de concerned on other version. This vulnerability has been public since the year 2012 : [https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/20856] During the tests, payloads allowing the opening of pop-up display were realized and are always visible at the following address: [https://xwiki.fsisandbox.atos.net/bin/view/XWiki/TestDigitalSecurity?category=profile] It is also possible to redirect to an external site using the following payload: ** Once created, the payload remains stored on the server. Any user, authenticated or not, who visits the victim user's profile page (where the payload is located) will trigger the JavaScript code. Â  With these stored XSS, a malicious user can craft a payload for various purposes, whichÂ  include : * have the victim's browser execute any JavaScript code * redirecting a user to a website controlled by an attacker ; * getting some information about the victim (like their operating system) ; * creating forms to fool a user who will send its credentials ; * making requests and actions on the user's behalf and without their intent and full knowledge; * etc.
fields.summary: Stored XSS

fields.description:
* Add a right in a page A for a group B
*  Rename the group B to C 
* Go back in page's A "Page Administration" and see that group is updated and the the right is preserved
* Rename again the group C to D
* Go back in page's A "Page Administration" and see  that group is updated and the the right is not preserved
* Rename back the group D to Group C
* Go back in page's A "Page Administration" and see that group is updated and the the right that was previously missing is visible again. 

Meaning that the rights are not gone but not properly updated after a second rename of the group page.
fields.summary: Rights applied for a group are not updated after multiple renames of the group page

fields.description:
When modifying a page from the wiki which is part of an extension (depending on the type of that page in the extension descriptor) there is a warning that tells the user that some unexpected stuff may happen and asks them to force the editing, like this (example for the XWiki.XWikiSyntax page):

 !image-2021-08-10-11-50-38-966.png|thumbnail! 

When doing the same for a page that is a mandatory class which is initialized by XWiki upon start and re-set everytime when the wiki starts, there is no message at all. 
To reproduce, you can try to edit the page XWiki.XWikiComments and there will be no message.

Expected result: 
For these mandatory classes, there are actually 2 things that the user that makes the modification should be aware of:
* if a user changes them, things may not work as intended anymore - like for the extension pages
* (some of) those changes are not persisted: will be reset next time the class is used or next time the wiki is restarted - see, for example, XWIKI-18854 .
fields.summary: There is no warning when modifying or deleting mandatory classes of XWiki

fields.description:
The system filters are displayed in the notification preferences (global or local), in  a table separated from user filters after XWIKI-18406: 

 !image-2021-08-03-16-38-55-004.png|thumbnail! 

The handling of the channels (formats) of these filters is difficult to understand:
* why is there a single filter for both formats for the "own event" and the "system" filters while the other filters have one filter per format?
* a consequence of this is that a user cannot control the notifications for the System user changes individually in email and alert while it can for the other 2 filters. Is this true, there is no way to control that individually?
* why does "Minor event" name not end with "Filter" as the others do? Does it mean something else?
fields.summary: Incomprehensible channels (formats) configuration in notification system filters

fields.description:
This is about the autowatch configuration select, this one:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Vocabulary:
* It's not clear what "watching" means here, I think this is the only place where we use the "watch" action name on this screen
* The "watch" vocabulary is used in the tooltips of the switches that are displayed in the notifications menu under the bell icon
* The "watching" action (manual or automatic) is actually tightly related to the "Custom filters" table, that was added on the notification config screen as a separate item, by XWIKI-18406 . From a wording point of view, there is no explanation that they are almost one and the same thing.

Ordering:
* The autowatch feature is displayed above the system filters in the global configuration and above the event types in the user configuration, while it's strictly related to the Custom filters (added by XWIKI-18406 ). It should be displayed along with the Custom filters table, since it's concerning the same feature.
fields.summary: Inconsistent vocabulary and ordering of the "autowatch" feature in the user notification preferences

fields.description:
I've just installed XWiki from Debian packages and found that it depends on and thus installs a full PostgreSQL server. However, I already have an external database server setup for other projects, so I don't need (or better: want) another full server running on the wiki host.

Since the packages also don't ask for database parameters, I needed to manually dump the database after installation, import it on my database server and change the hibernate configuration.

It would be better if the package had specified alternatives for the database connection (like, for example: "postgresql|libpq" and in addition use Debian's package configuration system to ask for database parameters during package installation.
fields.summary: Debian packages install full PostgreSQL server

fields.description:
Hibernate is initialized at startup and extension having database mapping are also injecting their mapping at startup. The problem is that if you upgrade the extension then the classes Hibernate knows are the one from the previous classloader.

Ideally, we would need to recreate the Hibernate classloader as soon as the classloader of any of the currently registered hibernate entities is closed. There does not seems to be any way to know that in standard ClassLoader but we could add a #isClosed() in NamespaceURLClassLoader.

The workaround is to restart XWiki.
fields.summary: Classcastexception when requesting database object from an upgraded extension

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Edit a page in-place
 # Tick "Minor edit" checkbox
 # Click "Cancel" (or make some changes and click "Save & View")
 # Click Edit button to edit the page in-place again
 # Observe the state of theÂ "Minor edit" checkbox

EXPECTED RESULTS

The "Minor edit" checkbox is not checked.

ACTUAL RESULTS

TheÂ "Minor edit" checkbox remains checked.

As a result, all further in-place changes are saved as minor edits until the "Minor edit" checkbox is unticked or the page is refreshed (F5) in-place edit mode.

The issue doesn't reproduce if the page is edited in WYSIWYG mode.
fields.summary: Minor edit checkbox remains checked for further edits until explicitly unticked or the page is refreshed when in-place edit mode
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64bit, Chrome 92, using an instance of XWiki 13.4.2 on PostgreSQL 13, Tomcat 9.0.50

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 * Go to login page
 * Navigate the page with the keyboard

h2. Actual result
 * The form controls get the focus before the banner logo and actions

h2. Expected result

The banner elements get focus first, according to the following recommendation:
{quote}When users navigate sequentially through content, they encounter information in an order that is consistent with the meaning of the content and can be operated from the keyboard. This reduces confusion by letting users form a consistent mental model of the content.
{quote}
Source: [https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/focus-order.html]

In other pages than the login page, the banner elements get the focus first. Keeping the same order across pages is likely to help the user form a "consistent mental model", hence ease the user experience.

See also:
 * [https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H4.html]
fields.summary: On the login page, the form controls receive focus before the banner elements

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Open a fresh instance of XWiki 11.10.13
 # Go to Wiki Index and create a wiki from flavorÂ 
 # After it was created, get the time spent from the job (</rootStep> in <permdir>/jobs/status/wikicreation/createandinstall/<wikiname>/status.xml)
 # Repeat the same process on a fresh instance of XWiki 12.10.8

EXPECTED RESULTS

The time taken to create a wiki in both versions is about the same (or even better on XWiki 12.10.8).

ACTUAL RESULTS

The time required to create a wiki on XWiki 12.10.8 is much higher than on XWiki 11.10.13.

Here are the values obtained in my tests (test run 5 times, selected lowest value):
 * on 12.10.8:Â 22922654000 nanoseconds
 * on 11.10.13:Â 17088538500 nanoseconds
fields.summary: Creating a wiki from flavor is significantly slower on XWiki 12.10.8 than on 11.10.13
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64bit, Firefox 89, using an instance of XWiki 12.10.8 and 11.10.13 on Jetty+HSQLDB

fields.description:
{{XWikiDocument.getAttachmentDiff}} is currently using {{XWikiDocument.retrieveDeletedAttachment}} (https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/c8ef54e5edad98883ec37bea18edb78c39215348/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java#L6776-L6786) and the way that it is currently implemented leads to an inconsistent state simply because the retrieved attachment from the archive is not guaranteed to be the requested one.

The current logic just retrieves a deleted attachment that was:
* not deleted before the modification date of the requested attachment and
* that has the same version as the deleted attachment.

A check on the file name would have been helpful, as in my test, the code was looking for the just deleted attachment, but it returned the one deleted earlier, with a different file name, simply because they both had version {{1.1}}. It is also possible that there can be multiple version {{1.1}} deleted attachments in the archive, even for the same file name.

To be fair, even if the file name was right, there is still no guarantee that you really get the attachment you expect, as long as you are not using deleted attachment IDs (which are kind of inaccessible at this point in the code flow). The entire approach is sketchy and can lead to weird results.

So, if you are using the {{AttachmentDiff}} resulting objects, you can be surprised to find that the file name says it belongs to the attachment you asked for, but if you call {{getOriginalAttachment()}} on it, you can get an XWikiAttachment corresponding to another deleted attachment file.

All of the above have been observed while debugging the behavior of {{AttachmentEventGeneratorListener}} when deleting an attachment, for XWIKI-18775.
fields.summary: XWikiDocument.getAttachmentDiff can return diffs for other attachments than the requested one

fields.description:
The markup that was done for the login form to follow the "vertical form" standard macro in XWIKI-10698 uses a <dt> element as the last element of the <dl>, for the submit button.

 !image-2021-07-06-23-18-58-019.png|thumbnail! 

According to https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/grouping-content.html#the-dt-element , the dt element needs to be followed by an element in the dl, another <dt> or a <dd>.

Also:
* nothing in https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/FrontendResources/VerticalForms/ suggests that buttons should also be in a definition list
* it's not clear whether the name-value pair applies to the case of the button as well
* even if it would, all other inputs are <dd> elements, this is the only <dt> one, it's rather inconsistent-ish.

My proposal is to remove the dt markup from alltogether from the buttons.
fields.summary: Useless and somewhat invalid <dt> markup on the login form

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Open an instance of XWiki 8.4.6
 # Add a comment to a page (created or already existing, e.g. Sandbox)
 # Close the instance
 # Go to a newer instance (tested with 12.10.8 and 13.5) and copy/cut the
{code:java}
[...]webapps\xwiki{code}
folder and replace it (first delete the old one) in the same location on the older (8.4.6) version

 # Start XWiki and finish running the DW for upgrade
 # Go to the page where the comment was added, access History tab

EXPECTED RESULTS

The most recent page revision displayed is when the (last) comment was added (saved at the respective date and time).

ACTUAL RESULTS

There is an additional *empty* page revision saved at the time of the upgrade and which is displayed as the current version, having as summary:
{code:java}
Migrated property [author] from class [XWiki.XWikiComments]{code}
The issue was reproduced also when performing an upgrade from XWiki 9.11.8 to 12.10.8 or 13.5; however, it didn't reproduce when upgrading from XWiki 10.11.11.

The issue can be very important for wikis with a large volume of content, since it alters last modification dates of documents.

The issue was initially discovered by [~lucaa].
fields.summary: Empty revision is added in the history for pages with comments when upgrading from certain XWiki versions
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Edge 91, using a local instance of XWiki 8.4.6 and 9.11.8

fields.description:
Currently, in the notifications email the modified pages complete location is never displayed:
* the summary at the top of the email only displays the wiki and the pages, without displaying the paths of the pages in the wiki (1)
* on the details area the breadcrumbs of the pages (as added for XWIKI-14877 ) are displayed "collapsed" if too long (2)
** the collapsed form is the form where the middle part of the breadcrumb is displayed as ... when the breadcrumb is too long. 
*** in a browser the ... is clickable and expands to the full path, but in the email this does not happen.

1 and 2 can be noticed in the following image:
!Selection_129.png|thumbnail! 

Thus, there is no way in the email to know the full location of the modified page. This is particularily bothering for content that tends to be named the same but placed in different places of the wiki (for example, when using the diagram extension and the diagram macro, it would create pages called "Diagram" all the time - when receiving the notification, the location of the created page is interesting).

The simplest solution for this is to display the non-collapsed breadcrumb. The more complicated would be to display the full page tree in the preamble of the mail.
fields.summary: Display the whole breadcrumb of the pages in the notification email

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Access a page that has translations eg. Sandbox (can be unregistered user, admin or simple user)
 # Click on More Actions > ChildrenÂ   !Children.jpg!
 # Observe the listed results in the table and the number of results shown on topÂ   !Result.jpg!
 # Sort the table by the Title columnÂ   !SortTitle.jpg!
 # SortÂ the table by the Date columnÂ   !SortDate.jpg!

Expected results: The results shown in the table match with the number shown on top. The pages shown as result are only in the selected language of the wiki.

Actual results: The number of results shown on top isn't matching with the results shown in the table. When sorting by Title or by Date the pages that have other translations (then EN in this case) are shown.

Â 

Environment: Windows 10, XWiki 13.4.1 and 13.5 RC1 with MySQL 8.0 and IE 11, Chrome 91

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce on a hosted 12.10.6 or 10.11.9 Cloud wiki:
1. Upload file anexa11.pdf and file anexa21.pdf on the Sandbox page.
2. Delete anexa11.pdf 
3. Search for "anexa" on the top right search option
4. Uncheck Documents and check Attachments option


*Expected result:*
Only the anexa21.pdf file appears.

*Actual result on the hosted 12.10.6 version:*
Both anexa11.pdf and anexa12.pdf appear

Tried as well after that:
5. Deleted from Deleted attachments
6. Searched again

Same result: Both anexa11.pdf and anexa12.pdf appear.

 !image-2021-06-18-19-45-20-052.png|thumbnail! 

Accessing the resulted anexa11.pdf shows that the file does not exist: 
 !image-2021-06-18-19-53-49-914.png|thumbnail! 

From logs:
Suspecting that Solr is not notified of the deleted attachment because of the failure in 
{code}
Failed to send event [org.xwiki.bridge.event.DocumentUpdatedEvent@3f6d7d88] to listener [com.xpn.xwiki.internal.event.AttachmentEventGeneratorListener@8bd4d15]
{code}
Still a question: why the {code}deleteattachment{code} action end up in trying to get the contents of the attachment it has just deleted?

I did not reproduce on a freshly locally downloaded XWiki Jetty HSQLDB 12.10.6, on local Jetty HSQLDB 12.10.8 (current Long Term Support) or local Jetty HSQLDB 13.4. The search after deleting the file anexa11.pdf showed only anexa21.pdf , even if the file anexa11.pdf was not deleted as well from Deleted Attachments
fields.summary: Search results show deleted files

fields.description:
This issue is the same as issue XWIKI-3548 which still reproduces on a subwiki, at least for groups (probably for users as well).

* Create a group A on a subwiki
* Give some rights on a page of the same subwiki to group A
* Rename group A to group B
* Check the rights on the page from step 2 

Expected result:
* The rights given to group A are now given to group B

Actual result:
* The rights continue to be given to group A - this is only visible if looking at the rights of the page in object mode, in the administration of the page it will appear as no rights are given because the entity they're given to doesn't exist (anymore).
fields.summary: When renaming a group document on a subwiki, access rights are not correct

The links of the actions are http://localhost:8082/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/undefined and http://localhost:8082/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/undefined when listing the children of the Sandbox page.

fields.description:
In order to reproduce, we can use the example of the rights class & object.
Steps to reproduce:
* create a simple panel, containing the following code (listing all users of all rights objects of the current page):
{noformat}
{{velocity}}
#panelheader("Test property panel")
#set ($rights = $doc.getObjects("XWiki.XWikiRights"))
#foreach ($r in $rights)
  * Property test $doc.display('users', $r)
#end
#panelfooter()
{{/velocity}}
{noformat}
* set this panel on a page or space
* add a rights object on the page, by setting rights to some user on the page only (using administration for a non-terminal page or the Edit->rights for a terminal page)
* render the page in view mode

Expected results:
* the list of users of the right object is rendered graphically in the panel

Actual results:
* html is displayed by the panel
 !image-2021-06-16-20-02-38-002.png|thumbnail! 

If the same script is added in the document content, the property is displayed properly:
 !image-2021-06-16-20-03-13-912.png|thumbnail! 


Debugging shows that the variable isInRenderingEngine from line https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/xwiki-platform-12.10.5/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java#L3437 is false for panels and true for documents content, thus the difference in behaviour. Not sure if it's intended or not (and the rules for writing panels are different than what I did), but feels like a bug to me.
fields.summary: Object properties display are not wrapped with {{html}} macros in panels when containing HTML

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce : 
* Start a new wiki
* Create some users in your wiki, and make sure that at least one of these users is marked as disabled
* Create a new AWM that includes a list of users in its structure. We do an AWM because it generates automatically the sheet, the template, etc â¦ linked to the data structure. In practice, this issue is not linked to AWM itself.
* Create a new page for this AWM, and try to add a user in the list of users. Notice that even the disabled users are listed in the displayer of the list of users

In practice, a user could expect to see only users that are active on its wiki, as inactive users will refer to users that : 
* Either never validated their account 
* Or have been purposely disabled by the administrator (eg :Â an employee leaving the company)
fields.summary: The displayer for the "List of users" property suggests disabled users

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Login with Admin
# Create a page eg. P1 
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Social > Notifications
 # Set Pages Notifications to ONÂ 
 # Create a new user (e.g. U1)
 # Login with U1
 # Click on the Notifications bell
 # Click on Settings, in the right side of Notifications

Expected results:Â For a new user, all settings configured by Admin in Administration are reflected in the user's Notifications Preferences.

Actual results: Settings are shown as selected but a notification about the creation of his account appears in the Notification list.
fields.summary: User receives notification of his account creation when events are enabled by default by the admin

fields.description:
The livetable displaying listings of documents by calling {{getdocument.vm}} cannot display the rights action in the action column.

Cause:

see [https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/bd419a583691c1156a38e44022781ae876932da0/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/xwiki-platform-web-templates/src/main/resources/templates/getdocuments.vm#L176]

{{hasrigths}} is not affected in {{$row}} following the pattern used for the other rights.

{{$isAdvancedUser}} is undefined, hence considered as false, making {{hasrights}} always {{false}}.

Â 

Impacted locations :
 * children.vm
* deletespace.vm
* getdocuments.vm
* siblings.vm
* delete.vm
fields.summary: The rights action is never displayed in the livetable using getdocuments.vm

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Create a subwiki
 # Go to subwiki > Administer Wiki > Wikis> Descriptor
 # Update the Description field
 # Click 'Save'

EXPECTED RESULTS

The warning message is displayed properly, without any typo or other characters.

ACTUAL RESULTS

There are some additional unnecessary characters displayed in the message:

"The new owner's user does not exist or it may come from a different wiki.*\n*Are you sure you want to use it and continue with the save operation?"

Â 

!Additional_characters_Wiki_Descriptor.png|width=449,height=313!

I've tested also on XWiki 12.10.7 and 13.3, but the warning message when editing a wiki descriptor from Administration is not being displayed.
fields.summary: Additional unnecessary characters displayed in warning message when editing a subwiki descriptor from Administration
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 91, using a local instance of XWiki 13.4 (PostgreSQL 13/ Tomcat)

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Users & Rights > Rights
 # Check 'Require unregistered users to solve a CAPTCHA when posting a comment on a page'
 # Create a page
 # On that page, go to Administer Page > Users & Rights > Rights: Page > Users
 # Grant 'Comment' right to Unregistered users
 # Logout
 # Add some comments as a guest user by filling the CAPTCHA

EXPECTED RESULTS

The comment are added successfully without errors.

ACTUAL RESULTS

Sometimes when adding a comment one after another or just at the first comment, it appears to be added, but if the page is refreshed, it disappears.

In console, there is the following error:

It is to be mentioned that the issue reproduces a bit randomly (couldn't find a direct pattern to reproduce it) and I've reproduced it on Chrome 91 and on Edge 91 and also on XWiki 13.3 and 12.10.7.

fields.description:
How to reproduce (requires 2 or 3 different users):
* on a page of a wiki, use notifications macro with the useUserPreferences on "false", and with events restricted to the current wiki
** the notifications macro used on the Dashboard of the standard distribution is such a usage
** such a usage will display all the events of the scope for which it's used (the current wiki, on the Dashboard, for example), _not contextualized to the preferences of the current user viewing the page_
* with one of the users (kbernick in my example below), create a page
* in the content of this page, mention another user (Dina Dorf in my example below)
* login with yet another user (Admin in my example below) and access the page that displays the event stream using the notifications macro (the Dashboard, for example)

Expected result:
* the mention is displayed in the event stream informing correctly that user kbernick mentioned user Dina Dorf in a page

Actual result:
* the mention is displayed in the event stream as if the current user (Admin) was mentioned. The message is "You have received one mention", which is the same with the message displayed in the notifications of the mentioned user

See screenshot:
 !Selection_083.png|thumbnail! 

Side-effect:
User kbernick, who is the mentioner, sees the same message "You have received one mention" which is rather misleading (to say the least). I don't think the message needs to be contextualized to who sees it (displayed differently for the mentioned or mentioner user), it should just be neutral enough.
fields.summary: Mentions are displayed in the event stream of a wiki as addressed to the current user when they're actually not

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE

Preconditions: The XWiki instance has the Mail Sending configured. An user (e.g. U1) is created and has a valid e-mail address set on its profile (e.g. a Gmail one).
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Look & Feel > Themes and upload a large logo for the wiki
 # Configure Microsoft Outlook (I've tested with Microsoft 365 package version 2014 - 16.0.13929.20206)Â with the email account used by user U1
 # Login as user (U1)
 # Go to Notifications > Settings and set all Pages Notifications to ON (both menu and email)
 # Watch the wiki
 # Login as Admin
 # Create/update/comment a page
 # Trigger the 'Notifications daily email' job from Scheduler.WebHome
 # Go to Outlook and observe the mail received on the user's account

EXPECTED RESULTS

On the notifications mail, the wiki logo is displayed downsized, not in its original size.

ACTUAL RESULTS

On Microsoft Outlook, the logo is displayed in original size, being disproportioned with the mail's body.

Please see the attached screenshot from Gmail web client for comparison.

fields.description:
Currently, each (sub)wiki has its own name strategy configuration.
This has to negative consequences:
1. The configurations can be inconsistent, with subwikis having over-permissive configurations leading to document name incompatible with the server's restrictions.
2. The configuration cache is overriden by the latest edited configuration, so if a subwiki edit its configuration, it becomes global for all the wikis.

Proposition:
These two points can be solved by only proposing a single global configuration on the main wiki, and no in the sub-wikis.
fields.summary: Entity Name Validation scope should be shared and global

fields.description:
Same issue than https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-18635 but for various URL generated by the $xwiki.ss*x APIs.

Here are some examples you can find in the source of the XWiki Standard home page:

* {{/xwiki/bin/skin/resources/js/xwiki/widgets/modalPopup.css?cache-version=1619449877258&colorTheme=FlamingoThemes.Iceberg}} triggered in javascript.vm
* {{/xwiki/bin/skin/resources/uicomponents/viewers/tags.css?cache-version=1619449877274&colorTheme=FlamingoThemes.Iceberg}} triggered in documentTags.vm

I'm wondering if we should not either:
* always add the current color theme in the ss*x URLs
* add the current color theme in the ss*x URLs by default but introduce a parameter to disable it for a specific one
* introduce a parameter to disable it for a specific one to enable adding the current color theme in the ss*x URL
fields.summary: The changes on the color theme are not taken into account for various ss*x resources

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 * In section "Administration > Editing > Name strategies", select and save the "Preformatted names" strategy
 * In LibreOffice, create a document with several level 1 headings containing spaces, such as "Heading ABC" and "Heading DEF", then save it in ODT format
 * Create a page using type "Page from Office"
 * In the "Office Importer" screen, select the ODT file you just created, check "Split document" along level 1 headings, and hit "Import"

h2. Expected result

The document sections are splitted into subpages named "Heading-ABC" and "Heading-DEF" (spaces got replaced by dashes).
h2. Actual result

The resulting pages are named "Heading ABC" and "Heading DEF"
fields.summary: The page name strategy is not applied when performing an Office import with document split

fields.description:
The following type of content:
{noformat}
content before
{{formula}}V_c=\sqrt{{2 g}\cdot{(H_{am} - Y_c})}{{/formula}}
!!!this should not be part of the formula!!!
{noformat}
Renders as:
!formula-bug-escaping.png!
Suggests that the current handling of the formula macro makes it extremely fragile and prone to human error. The error is actually a typo at the end of the formula, instead of {{})}}}, it should have been {{)}}}}

In my case, the document content was large and followed by many other formulas. The rendering of the FormulaMacro was looping infinitely, with a stacktrace similar to:
{noformat}

        at net.sourceforge.jeuclid.elements.presentation.token.Mo.changeHook(Mo.java:297)
        at net.sourceforge.jeuclid.elements.presentation.token.Mo.handleEvent(Mo.java:734)
        at org.apache.batik.dom.events.EventSupport.fireEventListeners(EventSupport.java:320)
        at org.apache.batik.dom.events.EventSupport.fireEventListeners(EventSupport.java:362)

So we seem to have 2 big problems:
1. The parsing/escaping issue that allows invalid formula content to easily spill in wiki content from the rest of the document
2. The fact that the formula rendering seems to be sequential, rendering 1 formula at a time for all rendering threads, which is a big scalability bottleneck.
fields.summary: Formula macro infinite loop blocking all other pages with formulas

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
Unlike the WYSIWYG editor, the Wiki editor doesn't warn users when they leave the editor without saving their changes. From users' perspective, there is no reason for different handling though.

Please note that this was also the case in older XWiki versions. But now that it is much easier to unintentionally click on the "Edit" button instead of selecting another editor type (there is no practical on-hover popup anymore, just one narrow arrow instead), this makes this shortcoming even more disturbing.
fields.summary: Wiki editor - User can lose changes more easily now

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Access the XWiki instance with a low viewport (e.g. from a phone or a small screen device, like 360 x 740)
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to *Administer Wiki* > Users & Rights > Rights
 # Observe the title of the rights displayed

EXPECTED RESULTS

All rights displayed have their title displayed properly.

ACTUAL RESULTS

'Like' right is displayed as 'undefined'.

The same issue happens when accessing the page rights (from Administer Page > Users & Rights).
fields.summary: 'Like' right is displayed as 'undefined' in small viewports screens
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Firefox 88, using a local instance of XWiki 13.3 on Oracle 19c, Tomcat 9.0.45

components.name: Refactoring
components.description: Tools to refactor a wiki

fields.description:
Image references are supposed to be refactored, as well as links, when a page is renamed, however it does not work properly when the image is contained in a terminal page. 

Reproduction steps:
  - Create a terminal page, and add an image as attachment
  - In another space, create a second page and include the image of the first page in the content, and a link to the first page
  - Rename the first created page, to put it in another space
  - View the second page

Expected result:
  - The image is still displayed and the link points to the new page

Obtained result:
  - The link points to the new page, but the image is not displayed anymore. When checking the wiki code of the page, you can see that the reference is still pointing to the old page.
fields.summary: Image references are broken when contained in a renamed terminal page

fields.description:
When importing a docx containing images, see attached original image6.png, extracted directly via unzipping the docx from the officedocxfile\word\media directory the importer seems to
 * resize the image
 * convert the png to gif

resulting in a much worse resolution than in the original image in the docx file, see attachedÂ officedocxfile_html_2b99c5607cc7513e.gif produced by xwiki/office importer.

The installed office version is LibreOffice 7.1.2.2, XWiki is configured to manage it internally.

Note: Looks like the problem was mentioned in the forums in the past: [https://forum.xwiki.org/t/office-importer-application-image-issue/6605]Â but I couldn't find any existing issue neither still open nor closed during my search.
fields.summary: Office Importer resizes and converts images imported from docx

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Access the instance with Firefox (I've tested with Firefox 88)
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Administer Wiki > Users & Rights > Authentication
 # Hover over the input forms under "Maximum number of authorized attempts" and "Time window for login failures" sections and increase or decrease the value from the steppersÂ on the right side of each input form
 # Access the instance with IE11 and go to the same location
 # Hover over the same two input forms under "Maximum number of authorized attempts" and "Time window for login failures" sections

EXPECTED RESULTS

When mouse hovered, the steppers are displayed on the respective forms on all browsers and the values are increased/decreased accordingly when their arrow up/arrow down buttons are clicked.

ACTUAL RESULTS

On Firefox (88), the steppers are displayed always (even if the forms are not hovered) and when clicked, nothing happens.

On IE11 browser, the steppers are not displayed at all. However, if clicked inside forms, an "X" - Cancel button is displayed in steppers' place.

On Chrome (90) and Edge (90) browsers, the steppers work as expected.
fields.summary: Issues with steppers on some input areas from Administration Authentication section on IE11 and Firefox
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Firefox 88 and IE11, using a local instance XWiki 13.3 on Oracle 19c, Tomcat 9.0.45

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Login as Admin
 # Enable Message Stream fromÂ Administration
 # Create an user (e.g. U1)
 # Login with U1
 # Go to User Index, click on Admin's profile and click on "Not following" button to start following him
 # Login with Admin
 # Go to its own user's profile
 # Under Send message write a message and select Visible to 'Followers'
 # Click Share
 # Login with U1 and observe the notifications list

EXPECTED RESULTS

The message received by U1 is displayed only in Dashboard Activity Stream, not in Notifications list, since all Message StreamÂ toggles (Notifications menu and Email) are OFF (thus including 'Message sent by someone you are following' sub-toggle).

ACTUAL RESULTS

The message is received in Notifications list, although the Message Stream toggles are OFF.

If the message is received by U1 from an user which is not followed, the message is displayed only on Dashboard Activity Stream.
fields.summary: Messages sent to followers are received in Notifications list even if Message Stream toggles are OFF

The corners of the save buttons are not rounded on the right side, I would kind of expected them to be, to be consistent with the cancel button that is all rounded:

Better visible in a color theme that uses darker colors for the buttons:

fields.description:
It seems the behavior of Tomcat changed regarding the implementation of ServletRequest#getServerPort(): it used to return -1 when the port was not explicitly provided in the source URL, but it now returns the resolved real port.

This does not happen with pure HTTP proxy (so not through AJP protocol) where the "x-forwarded-host" HTTP headers is set (which bypass ServletRequest#getServerPort()).
fields.summary: Generated external URL can contain a useless port with recent version of Tomcat proxied through AJP

fields.description:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE

Preconditions: The the Blog Applications is installed and Email sending is configured from Administration.
 # Login as Admin
 # Create an user (e.g. U1, with a valid email address)
 # Login as U1
 # Go to Notifications Settings > Applications section and set *Blog* toggles to ON
 # Login as Admin
 # Go to Blog
 # Fill a new post name and click 'Create' to create a new blog post
 # In 'Content' field, write a short sentence and mention user U1 (like "Hey @U1 how are you?")
 # Select 'Publish' to publish the blog post
 # Click 'Save & View'
 # Trigger the 'Notifications daily email' job from Scheduler.WebHome
 # Observe the email received for user U1

EXPECTED RESULTS

On received email, the Blog notification displays in its body (the block quote) the sentence with the user mention.

ACTUAL RESULTS

Only the words from the sentence are displayed, without the user mention, see attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Blog email notifications do not display user mentions in their body
fields.environment: Windows 10 Pro 64 bit, Chrome 90, using a local instance of XWiki 12.10.6 on PostgreSQL 13, Tomcat

fields.description:
XWiki.Mail objects currently support {{text}} and {{html}} parts and, regardless if any of them are empty, they will always generate 2 parts in the final email message.

This can be problematic when the {{text}} is empty but the {{html}} is not (i.e. "html only email") because some tools that process these emails (e.g. jira when automatically creating an issue from an email) usually tend to prefer the {{text}} value, if it exists, over the {{html}} value. Normally, if no {{text}} value exists, the {{html}} value is ran through some sort of html-to-text rendering/conversion but, if the {{text}} value does exist, even if it's empty, it will be taken as it is and the {{html}} value will be discarded. Sure, it's debatable if this usecase could have been handled on the tool side as well (i.e. by Jira, in this example), but we should not be in this situation from the first place and, if we detect an empty part (e.g. {{text}}), we should not include it in the email message.

The same logic applies for empty {{html}} parts, as we could have a "text-only" email message.

My conclusion is that we should not include *empty* (not blank) parts in emails generated from template. More specifically, fix the handling done around https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/5101b9c/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-mail/xwiki-platform-mail-send/xwiki-platform-mail-send-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/mail/internal/factory/template/AbstractTemplateMimeBodyPartFactory.java#L78-L82

2 questions remain:
# what do we do when both parts are empty? I would assume that, in this case, we would be justified to send an empty {{text}} part.
# what do we do if we really want to send an empty {{text}} part with our {{html}} part? I would suggest that if the user really wants to achieve this, they should add a space in their {{text}} field.

FTR, the ideal solution would be XWIKI-10638 which would better address the usage of message parts, but, until then, the current implementation could be fixed/improved to cover the current issue.
fields.summary: Empty part included in mails generated from XWiki.Mail templates

fields.description:
This is because, in {{XWikiServletContextListener}}, we call {code}ecm.initialize(this.getClass().getClassLoader());{code} which registers all the components found in {{components.txt}} but at this time, there's no {{ComponentEventManager}} set in the Component Manager and thus no event is sent for them.

The solution should be to set the {{StackingComponentEventManager}} in the ComponentManager before {{ecm.initialize()}} is called.
fields.summary: ComponentDescriptorAddedEvent events are not sent for core components

  - Register a new user
  - Type username "foo-bar"

Expected result:
